thread.title_full: What you need to know for fall 2024 graduation

author: Guinevere Grant
title: What you need to know for fall 2024 graduation
text:
Commencement day is one of the busiest days on the University of Georgia’s campus with students, friends and families celebrating a major accomplishment.
The Red & Black has compiled information on locations, parking, times and more.
The undergraduate commencement ceremony will begin at 10 a.m. on Friday, Dec. 13 at Stegeman Coliseum. The graduate ceremony will be held later that afternoon at 2:30 p.m. in Stegeman Coliseum.
For those who can’t attend in person, the fall undergraduate commencement ceremony will be broadcasted live on the commencement homepage beginning at 9:55 a.m. and the graduate commencement will be broadcasted at 2:25 p.m.
When should I be there?
Gates for the undergraduate commencement will open at 8 a.m and at 1 p.m. for the graduate commencement
According to the UGA commencement page, undergraduate students should arrive before 9:15 a.m. and proceed directly to the floor of Stegeman Coliseum.
Graduate students should report to the practice gym on the second floor of Stegeman Coliseum Training Facility by 1:00 p.m. They should enter through the doors closest to the Carlton Street Parking Deck on Smith Street.
Do I need a ticket?
For undergraduate commencement, tickets are required and registration has closed.
Undergraduate degree recipients were eligible to register for up to four guest tickets and one additional ticket for themselves. These tickets are digital and were sent on Wednesday, Nov. 20.
Tickets will not be required for the graduate commencement this fall.
Where should I park?
For both commencements, parking is free and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Guests are suggested to park at South Campus Deck (S11), Carlton Street Deck (S15) and Foley Field Lot (S14). The McPhaul Lot (S10) and the Coverdell Lot (S16) are reserved for designated participants by permit only.
Parking for guests with disabilities will be available in the Hoke Smith Annex Lot (S12) adjacent to Stegeman Coliseum. The main entrances to Stegeman Coliseum along Sanford Drive and Carlton Street are wheelchair-accessible.
Who are the speakers?
The scheduled undergraduate commencement ceremony speaker will be Judge Lisa Godbey Wood, a 1990 summa cum laude graduate of the UGA School of Law and a 1985 First Honor Graduate of UGA.
John Anthony Maltese, associate dean of the School of Public and International Affairs and the Albert B. Saye Professor of American Government and Constitutional Law in the Department of Political Science will be the graduate commencement ceremony speaker.
Where should I sit?
Undergraduates will be seated by their school or college and graduates will be seated by their degree. Seating charts for graduate students will be available one week prior to commencement and the seating chart for undergraduate students is available online.
For guests with wheelchairs, seating is very limited. Disability and companion seating is located along the top row of the lower level of Stegeman Coliseum. Disability seating allows access for one person in a wheelchair and one companion. Additional family members will have to sit separately in the general seating area.
What am I allowed to bring?
There is a clear bag policy for both commencement ceremonies. This means guests and students should not bring bookbags. Items that are permitted include bags that are clear plastic, vinyl or PVC and do not exceed 12" x 6"x 12"; one gallon clear plastic freezer bags; small clutch bags that do not exceed 4.5" x 6.5" or bags that contain necessary medical items.
Food and beverage items must fit inside the permitted sized bags.
Guests are allowed to bring in umbrellas and cameras, but camera bags must adhere to the clear bag policy,
Strollers may be stored in designated areas in the concourse, but aren’t allowed in the seating areas.
Guests are not permitted to bring wrapped gifts or packages where the contents aren’t visible; large items such as balloons, banners, posters, or amplification equipment; alcohol; tobacco or glass and aluminum containers.
Helpful tips
According to the commencement page, on-site wheelchairs will not be available. Guests who may need one are encouraged to bring their own.
Students should leave purses, coats and other belongings with family members, and should pick a place to meet family and friends once the ceremony is complete.
Once graduates have found their seat, they should remain in them and not stand in the aisles.
